etymology.description: Depicts cloth on a loom -> phonetically borrowed for 爾(爾) (ěr, "you")
etymology.interpretation: The character originally represented woven cloth due to its shape depicting a loom with threads. Over time, it was phonetically borrowed to represent the pronoun 'you'.
etymology.simplification: 尔(爾) is a variant of 尒(尒), an abridged form of 爾(爾) and officially adopted as its simplified version in 1956.

examples.chinese: 尔今日来访(尔今日來訪)，令我欣然(令我欣然)。
examples.pinyin: ěr jīntiān lái fǎng, lìng wǒ xīn rán.
examples.english: You visited today, which delighted me.

examples.chinese: 尔之所愿(尔之所願)，吾尽力为之(吾盡力為之)。
examples.pinyin: ěr zhī suǒ yuàn, wú jìn lì wéi zhī.
examples.english: I will do my best for what you wish.
